question.text: Which of the following is correct regarding genetic code?

options.text: UUU is the initiation codon which also codes for phenylalanine
There are 64 triplet codons and only 20 amino acids
Three random nitrogen bases specify the placement of one amino acid
UAA is the nonsense codon which also codes for methionine

solution.text: There are 64-triplet codons which code for 20 amino acids. This is due to the degeneracy of code as some amino acids are influenced by more than one codon. Only tryptophan and methionine are specified by single codons. All other amino acids are specified by two (e.g., phenylalanine - UUU,UUC) to six (e.g., arginine - CGU, CGC, CGA, CGG, AGA, AGG) codons.
